modules.description: This module builds and queries a vantage point tree for efficient nearest neighbor and range searches in a metric space. It supports operations like creating a tree from a list of points, finding the nearest neighbor, retrieving points within a tolerance, and checking tree validity. Concrete use cases include spatial indexing for geographic data or clustering algorithms requiring fast distance-based queries.

Implements a vantage point tree for efficient nearest neighbor and range searches in metric spaces. It supports building a tree from a list of points, querying the nearest neighbor, and retrieving points within a specified distance. Useful for spatial indexing in geographic data systems or accelerating distance-based clustering algorithms.

This module offers a comprehensive toolkit for array and matrix manipulation, spanning element-level access, bulk transformations, and algorithmic operations. It supports OCaml arrays and matrices with functions for initialization, in-place mutation, functional mapping, folding over indexed elements, pairwise array operations, and statistical analysis, alongside utilities for sorting, shuffling, and sequence conversion. Typical applications include numerical computations requiring efficient array creation and modification, data processing pipelines leveraging folds and filters, and statistical methods utilizing bootstrapping or min/max aggregation with default values.

This module combines array manipulation capabilities with spatial indexing structures. It provides functions for creating, transforming, and analyzing arrays and matrices, including element-wise operations, folds, and statistical aggregations. It also includes a vantage point tree implementation for efficient nearest neighbor and range queries over metric spaces, enabling applications such as geographic data retrieval and clustering.
